r.d: * Building absolute URIs * RFC compliant HTTP redirects * RFC compliant HTTP date handling * Parsing of HTTP headers and responses * Caching by "Last-Modified" and/or ETag (with 'on the fly' option for ETag generation from buffered output) * Sending data/files/streams with (multiple) ranges support * Negotiating user preferred language/charset * Convenient request functions to HEAD/GET/POST if libcurl is available * HTTP auth hooks (Basic) * HTTPi, HTTPi_Response and HTTPi_Request classes (HTTPi_Request only with libcurl)
r.n: * fixed overflow in http_split_response() - removed HTTPi_Request::getResponseHeaders() + added HTTPi_Request::getResponseCode() + added HTTPi_Request::getResponseHeader([string name]), allowing retrieval of single header values + HTTPi_Request::getResponseInfo([string name]) now allows retrieval of single info values + vastly enhanced http_absolute_uri()
